basics.name: Linh Pham
basics.summary: Undergraduate researcher in adaptive AI, VR, and HCI at Duke Kunshan & Duke University. My work focuses on trust, explainability, and user understanding in immersive AI systems.

education.area: Dual B.S. in Computer Science and Interdisciplinary Studies (Computation & Design; Computer Science)
highlights: Bachelor thesis: Trust and Reliability in Sketch-Based AI Systems for VR.
Selected coursework: Probability & Statistics, Algorithms, Modeling & Predicting, Computer Organization, Discrete Math.

work.name: Crimson Education
highlights: Mentored 15+ high school students across APAC on research and technical projects.
Guided ideation, prototyping, and user research; helped students produce apps, VR demos, and design portfolios.

work.name: Duke Kunshan University
highlights: Designed the full Campus Connect platform interface in Figma.
Led user testing sessions with 100+ DKU students.
Improved navigation flows and assisted rollout of features including Rate My Professor.

research.name: Trust & Reliability in Sketch-Based AI Systems (VR)
highlights: Built a VR sketching environment tracking hand trajectory, pauses, speed, and stroke patterns.
Integrated Gemini API with behavioral features to generate personality feedback.
Designed user studies using trust scales and feedback stability manipulation.

research.name: VR Bodystorming Tool for Collaborative Design
highlights: Developing a multi-user VR prototyping system for spatial ideation.
Created UI layouts, icons, and modular 3D props.
Improved interaction responsiveness and reduced frame instability.

research.name: iRow VR Exergame
highlights: Worked on biometric-driven VR rowing with adaptive music and pacing cues.
Conducted pilot usability study evaluating engagement and safety.
Analyzed user interpretation of adaptive AI behavior.

research.name: GRIPS Program – Big Data & Networking Lab
highlights: Fine-tuned Qwen2.5-1.5B with LoRA for financial QA using HuggingFace SFT Trainer.
Improved accuracy by ~25% and reduced hallucinations by ~30%.
Reviewed Transformer architectures (BERT, GPT) and attention mechanisms.

research.name: VR-HEAL: VR Training for Catheter Placement
highlights: Built VR catheter placement simulation with haptic interactions.
Developed scenario-authoring tools for instructors.
Optimized environment geometry and lighting for smooth performance.
Supports 50+ residents with wellness, conflict mediation, and emergency response.
Directed practices; choreographed and performed for >1000 attendees.
2nd Place – Pom-Pom (Youth Open B), 2025 China Yangtze River Delta Cheer Dance Competition.
Managed events and budget for ~400 DKU students studying at Duke.
Led community building and wellness programming.
